author: MTN News
title: Seven people dead in recent crashes across Montana
text: GREAT FALLS — Seven people have died and several others were injured in crashes across Montana between August 9 and August 14, 2024. MISSOULA COUNTY: A 53-year-old Missoula man died in a one-vehicle crash on U.S. Highway 93 near Evaro on Wednesday, August 14, 2024. The crash happened just after 11 p.m. According to the Montana Highway Patrol, the driver of the Ford F-350 pickup truck was heading south on U.S. Highway 93. Near mile marker 5, the pickup truck went off the road, hit a guardrail, and rolled. The driver was thrown from the vehicle by the force of the crash and died at the scene. The name of the man has not yet been released. The MHP says that alcohol is believed to have been a factor in the crash. The driver was the only occupant of the vehicle. RICHLAND COUNTY: A child died after reportedly being hit by a pickup truck in Richland County on Wednesday, August 14, 2024. It happened at about 4:30 p.m. just outside the town of Sidney near the intersection of County Road 352 and County Road 126. According to the Montana Highway Patrol, several occupants of the pickup truck got out of the vehicle, including a one-year boy. The MHP report states that the 28-year old male driver "put the vehicle in reverse to exit the driveway, unaware that the juvenile was behind the vehicle." The vehicle struck the child, who died at the scene. No other details have been released at this point. PONDERA COUNTY: One person died and three others were injured in a one-vehicle crash in Pondera County on Monday, August 12, 2024. It happened at about 2:30 p.m. along BIA Route near mile marker 4, near the community of Heart Butte. The driver of the Chevy Impala was a 23-year male from Spokane, Washington. The passengers were a 19-year old male from Lethbridge in Alberta, Canada; a 17-year old male from Spokane; and an 18-year old male from Spokane. According to the Montana Highway Patrol, the car was northbound on BIA Route 1 and entered a right-hand curve. The car crossed into the southbound lane and began slide, causing it to go off the road where it hit a delineator post. The car then began to rotate, and the driver-side tire furrowed into the soft soil, causing it to roll twice and crash through a fence. All four were taken to the Indian Health Service clinic in Browning. The 19-year old male from Lethbridge died; his name has not been released at this point. NOTE: The MHP report says the young man who died was from Lethbridge, but family members have contacted MTN News to say that he was actually from Heart Butte. The nature and severity of the injuries sustained by the others have not been disclosed. The MHP says that all four were wearing seatbelts, and that alcohol and speed may have been factors in the crash. GALLATIN COUNTY: One person died in a two-vehicle crash in Gallatin County on Wednesday, August 14, 2024. It happened at about 6:25 p.m. near the intersection of Blackwood Road and Gooch Hill Road. The crash involved two vehicles - the first was a Subaru Impreza driven by a 27-year old man from Oregon, with a 29-year old male passenger from Georgia. The second vehicle was a Harley Davidson motorcycle driven by a 57-year old man from Bozeman. According to the Montana Highway Patrol, the motorcyclist was northbound on Gooch Hill Road when the Subaru turned left onto the road from Blackwood Road. The MHP says the motorcyclist was speeding and "attempted to slow for vehicle 1, but lost control of the motorcycle and crashed." The motorcyclist died due to his injuries, and he was not wearing a helmet, according to the MHP. The man's name has not yet been released. The two people in the Subaru were not seriously injured; they were wearing seatbelts. The MHP report says that alcohol may have been a factor in the crash. DEER LODGE COUNTY: One person died and two others were injured in a two-vehicle crash in Deer Lodge County on Monday, August 12, 2024. It happened at about 10 a.m. near the intersection of Galen Road and South Frontage Road near the town of Anaconda. The two vehicles involved were a Chevy Cobalt driven by a 27-year old man from New Port Richey, Florida; and a Honda Odyssey driven by a 26-year old man from Deer Lodge, with a female passenger also from Deer Lodge. According to the Montana Highway Patrol, the driver of the Chevy was eastbound on Galen Road, and the driver of the Honda was southbound on South Frontage Road. The MHP says the driver of the Chevy failed to yield the right of way and pulled into the intersection. The driver of the Honda swerved to avoid a collision, but the Honda hit the driver-side door of the Chevy. The Chevy was pushed off the road and overturned onto its roof. The Honda went off the road to the left and overturned onto its right side. The driver of the Chevy died at the scene; his name has not been released at this point. The two people in the Honda were taken to a hospital in Anaconda; the nature and extent of their injuries has not been disclosed. The MHP says that all three people were wearing seatbelts, and that alcohol and speed were not factors in the crash. PONDERA COUNTY: A 44-year old man from Idaho died in a motorcycle crash in Pondera County on Sunday, August 11, 2024. It happened just before noon along Interstate 15 near mile marker 344. According to the Montana Highway Patrol, the man was heading north on I-15 when the rear tire of his motorcycle blew out. He apparently was not able to gain control of the motorcycle, and was thrown from the motorcycle and landed in a ditch. The MHP says the man died at the scene; his name has not been released. According to the MHP, the man was not wearing a helmet. Impaired driving and/speed were not factors in the crash. FLATHEAD COUNTY: One person died and two were injured in a two-vehicle crash in Flathead County on Friday, August 9, 2024. It happened at about 9:45 a.m. along Montana Highway 83 near mile marker 86, several miles northeast of Bigfork. According to the Montana Highway Patrol, the collision involved an Audi A6 driven by a 46-year old woman from Butte, who was wearing a seatbelt. She was the only occupant of the car. The second vehicle was a Toyota Tundra driven by a 21-year old man from Lakeside, who was wearing a seatbelt. There was a 21-year old male passenger in the Tundra, also from Lakeside. Investigators believe the driver of the Audi was trying to make a left turn on to Wolf Creek Ranch Road when she crossed into oncoming traffic, and the vehicles collided. The driver of the Audi died at the scene; her name has not yet been released. The two occupants of the Toyota were taken to Logan Health in Kalispell with what are said to be "serious" injuries. According to the MHP, impaired driving is suspected as a factor in the crash, although the report does not indicate which driver may have been impaired.

author: A. A.
title: PROCESIÓN SANTO ENTIERRO ZAMORA | Sigue en directo la procesión del Santo Entierro
text: DIRECTO | Sigue en directo la procesión del Santo Entierro El desfile realizará su recorrido largo si la lluvia no lo impide A. A. La lluvia da una tregua a la Semana Santa de Zamora y el sol sonríe a la Real Cofradía del Santo Entierro. A las 16.00 horas se realiza el sermón del Descendimiento en la iglesia de San Esteban y sobre las 16.30 está previsto que se inicie la procesión con su recorrido largo, es decir, el inicialmente previsto. No obstante, hay que señalar que la Agencia Estatal de Meteorología pronostica lluvia desde última hora de la tarde. Sermón del Descendimiento Recorrido inicial Sobre las 16.30, la procesión partirá de la plaza de San Esteban, donde la cofradía tiene el grueso de sus pasos en una carpa provisional. El desfile continuará hacia la calle de pianista Berdión, calle de San Torcuato y la calle de Benavente para tomar Santa Clara rumbo a la Plaza Mayor, pasando por delante del edificio del Ayuntamiento Viejo, hacia la Rúa de los Francos, plaza de los Ciento para proseguir por la Rúa de los Notarios hacia la Catedral. Tras la estación, el recorrido, que partirá desde el primer templo diocesano, será el inverso por la Rúa de los Notarios, plaza de los Ciento, Rúa de los Francos, plaza Viriato, Ramos Carrión, Plaza Mayor (junto al Ayuntamiento Viejo), calle Renova, plaza Sagasta, calle San Torcuato, Pianista Berdión y plaza de San Esteban para regresar al templo de salida. author: Saurabh
title: Vivek Srivastava Named DG Of Fire Service, Civil Defence & Home Guards
text: The Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) has recently approved the appointment of Vivek Srivastava, a seasoned 1989-batch IPS officer of Gujarat cadre, as the Director General of Fire Service, Civil Defence & Home Guards under the Ministry of Home Affairs. Department of Personnel & Training Issues Official Order on December 28 The decision was made official through an order issued by the Department of Personnel & Training (DoPT) on December 28. This significant appointment is set to take effect from the date of Srivastava’s joining the post and will continue until June 30, 2025, or until further orders, whichever occurs earlier. Background of Vivek Srivastava Vivek Srivastava has a distinguished career as an Indian Police Service (IPS) officer, with extensive experience spanning over three decades. Having entered the service in the year 1989, he has served in various capacities, showcasing leadership skills and dedication to public service. Srivastava is known for his commitment to upholding law and order and has consistently demonstrated excellence in his roles within the police force. Gujarat Cadre and IPS Journey Srivastava’s roots lie in the Gujarat cadre, where he began his career. Over the years, he has navigated the complexities of law enforcement, tackling challenges with strategic acumen. His service in the IPS has been marked by a relentless pursuit of justice, earning him a reputation as a principled and effective officer. Current Position and Transition As of now, Vivek Srivastava holds the position of Special Director in the Intelligence Bureau. His current responsibilities reflect the trust and confidence reposed in him by the government in matters of national security and intelligence. The transition to his new role as the Director General of Fire Service, Civil Defence & Home Guards signals a shift in focus towards critical aspects of public safety and emergency services. Future Endeavors and Challenges Srivastava’s tenure in the new role will likely bring forth various challenges and opportunities. Managing fire services, civil defense, and home guards involves intricate coordination and strategic planning. As the head of these vital departments, Srivastava will play a crucial role in ensuring the safety and well-being of citizens, particularly during emergencies and unforeseen situations. Important Questions Related to Exams Q1: What is Vivek Srivastava’s current position before assuming the role of Director General of Fire Service, Civil Defence & Home Guards? a) Director General of Fire Service b) Special Director in the Intelligence Bureau c) Home Guards Officer Q2: In which cadre did Vivek Srivastava begin his career as an IPS officer? a) Maharashtra cadre b) Gujarat cadre c) Uttar Pradesh cadre Q3: Until when is Vivek Srivastava’s appointment as the Director General set to continue, as per the Department of Personnel & Training (DoPT) order? a) June 30, 2024 b) June 30, 2025 c) December 28, 2023 Q4: What key responsibilities will Vivek Srivastava have in his new role as Director General of Fire Service, Civil Defence & Home Guards? a) Managing law and order b) Ensuring national security c) Overseeing public safety and emergency services Please provide your answers in the comments section.

organizations.name: civil defence & home guards the appointments committee
department of personnel & training issues official order

author: Carlos Greer
title: Drew Barrymore can't wait to turn 50: 'It can't come soon enough' - NewsBreak
text:
By Carlos Greer ,
1 hours ago
Drew Barrymore is the covergirl for The AARP magazine’s February/March 2025 issue. Ramona Rosales for AARP The Magazine Hitting the half-century mark “can’t come soon enough” for Drew Barrymore.
The talk show host told – you guessed it – AARP The Magazine, “It can’t come soon enough. I feel like Frodo. I see that brass ring and I’m so excited!,” she said likening herself to “The Lord of the Rings” character.
Barrymore says she’s the happiest she’s ever been in her life. Britney Spears’ ex Sam Asghari on why he still cares for her and his ‘crash course in Hollywood’
She added, “I have no issues with aging. This is the happiest I’ve been in my life.”
Barrymore is seemingly celebrating her upcoming milestone by gracing the February/March 2025 cover of AARP. The former child star’s journey to the big 5-Oh hasn’t been smooth sailing. In the issue, she opens up about about her descision to swear off alcohol , men and acting.
Watch Mindy Kaling tell Drew Barrymore her secret to balancing work and parenting
Her 2016 divorce from Will Kopelman, for example, felt like, “my dream family was falling apart,” she said.
Barrymore and her ex-husband Will Kopelman divorced in 2016. Getty Images for Baby Buggy “I didn’t know how to put one foot in front of the other – and I had grown up so fast – but now I didn’t know what age to feel,” she said and added, “I just knew that my life was heavy, and painful and sad… Eventually, thank goodness, I lifted myself out of it. I had two kids and I had to figure it out.”
CLICK HERE TO SUBSCRIBE TO PAGE SIX DAILY FOR MORE CELEBRITY NEWS
Barrymore and Kopelman share daughters, Olive, 12, and Frankie, 10, who, she says, encourage her to hop back into the dating pool.
The talk show host turns 50 on Feb. 22. CBS via Getty Images “My girls say I should go on dates, but I also know how I felt when men were around when I was little. It didn’t feel safe to me, so I’m probably overcautious from those experiences,” she said.
Barrymore turns 50 on Feb. 22 and she’s more grateful than ever. “I would have never guessed that I would feel peace. Thank you 50. Thank you, AARP!,” she said.
For more celebrity and entertainment news, visit pagesix.com.
1

author: Larissa Gabriela
title: Milton se torna o furacão mais poderoso de 2024!
text: O furacão Milton atraiu a atenção do mundo ao transformar-se em um dos ciclones mais poderosos da temporada de 2024 no Atlântico Norte. Iniciado em 05 de outubro sobre o Golfo do México, este sistema meteorológico mostrou uma intensificação surpreendente, exemplificando um fenômeno cada vez mais comum em tempos de aquecimento global. Milton, que inicialmente era categorizado como um furacão de nível 1, rapidamente escalou para categoria 5 em apenas 12 horas, antes de novamente se estabilizar em um nível 4 enquanto avançava em direção à Flórida. Esses rápidos desenvolvimentos levantam importantes questões sobre os fatores que impulsionam tais intensificações. Por que ocorrem essas rápidas intensificações? Segundo especialistas, o aquecimento das águas oceânicas e condições atmosféricas favoráveis são fatores-chave na rápida intensificação de furacões. As águas do Golfo do México estavam a cerca de 30°C, proporcionando energia abundante para fortalecer Milton . Além disso, o fraco cisalhamento vertical do vento permitiu que o sistema mantivesse sua estrutura organizada, incentivando ainda mais seu crescimento. O que está impulsionando o furacão Milton? Historicamente, a rápida intensificação como vista em Milton é rara, mas estudos indicam uma tendência de aumento. O Serviço Meteorológico Americano ( NWS ) identifica uma intensificação rápida quando há um aumento de pelo menos 56 km/h nos ventos sustentados em 24 horas. Milton quebrou essa marca ao aumentar seus ventos em 153 km/h, destacando-se entre os ciclones mais intensos registrados no Atlântico. - Milton (2024): pressão mínima de 897 hPa - Wilma (2005): pressão mínima de 882 hPa - Gilbert (1988): pressão mínima de 888 hPa Como o aquecimento global está relacionado? A influência do aquecimento global no comportamento dos ciclones é um ponto de intenso estudo científico. Conforme os oceanos se aquecem, mais energia está disponível para alimentar esses sistemas, resultando em furacões mais poderosos e frequentes. Estima-se que, embora o número total de ciclones possa diminuir, a intensidade dos que ocorrem tende a aumentar. Pesquisas sugerem que as rápidas intensificações, como a de Milton, não podem ser explicadas apenas pela variabilidade natural do clima. O impacto humano é um fator significativo nas mudanças ambientais, amplificando os efeitos do aquecimento global. O que esperar do futuro? Com o planeta em uma trajetória de aquecimento, furacões como Milton podem se tornar cada vez mais comuns. A temporada de furacões de 2024, com seus fenômenos intensos como Beryl, Helene e Milton, talvez seja um prenúncio do que está por vir. Preparamos uma lista dos principais fatores contribuintes para a intensificação dos furacões: - Temperatura elevada da superfície do mar. - Sistema de cisalhamento do vento favorável. - Alterações climáticas globais. Entender o impacto do aquecimento global nos sistemas meteorológicos é vital para prepararmos medidas eficazes de mitigação e adaptação. No futuro, poderemos precisar de estratégias mais robustas para enfrentar a intensificação e frequência dos ciclones tropicais. Siga a gente no Google Notícias
